result.execSummary:
The defendant Lorene J Griffin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA surcharges within one (1) year of today's date.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court waived all nonmandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Credit for six (6) months.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lorene J Griffin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Lorene J Griffin not in court, in custody.  Morgan Willz supervised by Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel WAIVED defendant's appearance.
Statements by state and defense counsel. Sentencing Proceeded. 
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 6 MONTHS time served, this is a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges within 1 YEAR of today's date, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. Court set matter for status conference in branch 23. 
  Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Lorene J Griffin not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record.  Case sheduled for sentencing, defendant not produced.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing hearing.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Lorene J Griffin not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for sentencing hearing.  Defendant not produced.  Defense requests another sentencing date. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lorene J Griffin in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Lorene J Griffin in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 46. jks  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-08-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Lorene J Griffin not in court, in custody, Not produced.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46.  Defense requests 60 days.  jks  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-14-2015 at 01:30 pm.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANY Walmart in Milwaukee County

Defendant Lorene J Griffin in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Lorene J Griffin in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
